text: In the State of Alabama, the three most common types of deeds used to convey real property are: 1) general warranty deed. 2) statutory warranty deed. 3) quitclaim deed. A statutory warranty deed in effect warrants only that the title to the real property has not been affected while the seller owned the real property.
